question:
A company runs an application on a group of Amazon Linux EC2 instances. For compliance reasons, the company must retain all application log files for 7 years. The log files will be analyzed by a reporting tool that must be able to access all the files concurrently.
Which storage solution meets these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
explanation: S3 is the most cost-effective for long-term log storage (7 years). It provides concurrent access to all files and can use lifecycle policies for further cost optimization. EBS is more expensive and not designed for long-term archival. Instance store is ephemeral.
